title: Barikui1
author: Barikui1
content: I just saw this picture on a news channel on my telegram account, @just news to be precise, and I was like wow, 14year of staying anonymous, it might actually look easy but it's not, it's definitely easier said than done.And to be honest here, I think it's a massive display of intelligence by satoshi because by now, am very much certain that he would have been tired already with the kind of questions he would still be answering mostly from hatersAnd this was written below, QuoteSatoshi Nakamotoâ€™s final forum post on Dec. 12, 2010, and his disappearance on Dec. 13 transferred Bitcoinâ€™s development responsibility to its decentralized community.@just ðŸ“„

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Barikui1 on December 13, 2024, 03:04:45 PMI was like wow, 14year of staying anonymous, it might actually look easy but it's not, it's definitely easier said than done.Yes, it was a perfect getaway plan. To exit the stage and watch how it unfolds from the sidelines. There are one or two persons out there who would definitely know everything about Satoshi.And they would have sworn a oath of secrecy. QuoteAnd to be honest here, I think it's a massive display of intelligence by satoshi because by now, am very much certain that he would have been tired already with the kind of questions he would still be answering mostly from hatersBy now he would have been arrested ot rather be the most wanted person in the world. Wanted by different governments for trying to collapse their economy or the world economic system. He would have been charged with manipulation, conspiracy and whatever legal jargons they would bring up.

There was never a time he wasn't anonymous. Posting on the forum does mean you aren't anonymous. For example you have posted this but I don't know who you are I just know you are a member here that makes you anonymous to me so are other members. You aren't required to give your real name or any of your documents when registering on the forum this goes to show that the forum promotes anonymity.

comments.author: PremiumcryptoHub
comments.body: According to Satoshi Nakamoto's profile, he was last active on this Bitcointalk forum on December 13, 2010. But he last posted on that account on December 12th. Since then, he has not logged into this forum to this day.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Staying anonymous from the forum and the entire Bitcoin ecosystem was indeed one of the best decisions Satoshi Nakamoto did for the total independency and full decentralization of Bitcoin as a digital currency that it is today. Because who knows what would have happened if he had not hid himself from the community and government, most especially during this Biden's administration that was totally against privacy for the past 3yrs, which we all know, led to the closure of major Bitcoin mixers in the industry. Because this day 13th December will always remain a remarkable day for every Bitcoin enthusiast and investor.

comments.author: ingiltere
comments.body: It shouldn't be hard for a dead person to stay anonymous.  Satoshi foresaw the future very well when he created Bitcoin and prepared for possible problems well in advance. That's why the theories that try to find him are just theories, they can't be proven. I think if Satoshi was still alive in this time period, he would have left a trace somewhere. I think it doesn't matter anymore, the Bitcoin he created continues to spread to every aspect of life.
